title: Marriage and Singleness
shortSummary: 1 Corinthians 7 addresses the Apostle Paul's guidance on marriage, singleness, and sexual relations within the Christian life. Paul emphasizes the value of both marriage and celibacy, encouraging believers to live according to their calling while maintaining holiness and devotion to the Lord.
timeline: c. AD 55 - Paul's First Epistle to the Corinthians during his Third Missionary Journey

keyCharacters.name: Paul
keyCharacters.description: The Apostle writing this letter, providing inspired instruction on marriage and singleness to the Corinthian church.

keyCharacters.name: Unbelieving Spouse
keyCharacters.description: Non-Christian husband or wife mentioned in the context of mixed marriages, with specific guidance on coexistence.

keyCharacters.name: Unmarried and Widows
keyCharacters.description: Groups addressed by Paul regarding singleness and celibacy as a viable and honorable state.

definitions.definition: Sexual immorality or unlawful sexual relations outside of marriage.
Lack of self-control, especially in sexual matters.
Set apart as holy; made clean or consecrated by association or faith.
A person, especially a woman, who has not engaged in sexual relations.

outline.heading: Instructions on Marriage and Sexual Relations
outline.description: Paul responds to questions about sexual morality, emphasizing the importance of marital fidelity and mutual conjugal rights to avoid temptation and maintain holiness.

outline.heading: Counsel on Singleness and Marriage
outline.description: Paul expresses his personal preference for celibacy but acknowledges marriage as a proper and honorable choice for those who cannot exercise self-control.

outline.heading: Guidance for Married Believers
outline.description: Paul relays the Lord's commands regarding marriage, separation, and divorce, especially addressing marriages between believers and unbelievers, encouraging peace and faithfulness.

outline.heading: Living According to One's Calling
outline.description: Paul instructs believers to remain in the social and religious condition in which they were called, emphasizing spiritual freedom in Christ over earthly status.

outline.heading: Advice on Virgins and Present Circumstances
outline.description: Paul offers his judgment on marriage during times of distress, urging believers to focus on serving the Lord without distraction, while affirming the legitimacy of marriage.

application: Pursue holiness in marriage by honoring mutual responsibilities and avoiding sexual temptation.
Consider singleness as a valuable calling that allows undivided devotion to the Lord.
Remain faithful and peaceful in mixed marriages, trusting God’s sanctifying power.
Live contentedly and faithfully in your current life situation, serving God wholeheartedly.

keyVerses.text: Let the husband render unto the wife due benevolence: and likewise also the wife unto the husband.
keyVerses.significance: This verse highlights the mutual responsibilities and love that should characterize Christian marriage.

keyVerses.text: But if they cannot contain, let them marry: for it is better to marry than to burn.
keyVerses.significance: Paul acknowledges marriage as a God-ordained solution to sexual temptation and a safeguard against sin.

keyVerses.text: But as God hath distributed to every man, as the Lord hath called every one, so let him walk. And so ordain I in all churches.
keyVerses.significance: This verse teaches contentment and faithfulness in one’s God-given calling and circumstances.

keyVerses.text: But she is happier if she so abide, after my judgment: and I think also that I have the Spirit of God.
keyVerses.significance: Paul affirms the blessing and wisdom of remaining single after a spouse’s death for undistracted service to the Lord.
